value.title: Biden chooses longtime adviser Ron Klain as chief of staff
value.excerpt: WASHINGTON -- President-elect Joe Biden has chosen his longtime adviser Ron Klain to reprise his role as his chief of staff, installing an aide with decades of experience in the top role in his White House.

value.title: The Health 202: Obamacare may be safer than ever. But Biden will struggle to expand it.
value.excerpt: Obamacare appears to be on stable ground, after several pivotal Supreme Court justices hinted yesterday they won’t strike it down. Follow the latest on Election 2020 Yet that ground is also politically dry for further attempts by President-elect Joe Biden to expand the law,

value.title: Mississippi Republican calls for his state to ‘succeed from the union’ after Biden victory
value.excerpt: The Magnolia State voted to remove the Confederate battle flag symbol from its own state flag earlier this year.

value.title: Pandemic is heading into its "darkest days," Biden coronavirus advisory board member warns
value.excerpt: "On Labor Day we were 32,000 cases a day in this country," Osterholm said. "Do not be at all surprised when we hit 200,000 cases a day."

value.title: Biden may face pressure to reshape Powell's Fed in first year
value.excerpt: Washington - U.S. monetary policy won't be a top-of-mind concern for President-elect Joe Biden as he prepares to take office in January, with the Federal Reserve's economic arsenal already deployed against an ongoing recession and decisions about federal spending more

value.title: Biden plans for White House as Trump plans rallies to protest his election loss
value.excerpt: Democrat Joe Biden won the U.S. presidential election on Saturday after a bitter campaign, sparking street celebrations among his supporters in major cities even as President Donald Trump refused to accept defeat.

value.title: Former President George W. Bush extends 'warm congratulations' to President-elect Joe Biden
value.excerpt: "I just talked to the President-elect of the United States, Joe Biden," former President Bush said, adding that he extended "warm congratulations."

value.title: Senate GOP declare "Senate is last line of defense" after Biden-Harris projected win
value.excerpt: With President-elect Joe Biden's projected electoral college victory, the nation's attention will now turn to the races which could determine the partisan balance of the Senate — and so determine whether Biden's agenda is implemented in his first term in office.

value.title: Breakingviews - Biden win sets scene for storm before the calm
value.excerpt: Americans chose Joe Biden as their 46th president. That should usher in a more predictable period for policymaking, and decisive action on containing Covid-19. But he faces three major challenges: voters’ effective rejection of his party’s punchier ideas,

value.title: Joe Biden urges patience, unity as he waits with the rest of America
value.excerpt: Joe Biden — like the rest of America — is still waiting. Despite being on the cusp of the presidency, Biden did not give the victory speech he and his campaign hoped he would deliver on Friday night.

value.title: Home vandalized after California man hangs effigy of Biden
value.excerpt: The Northern California home of a supporter of President Donald Trump was vandalized Friday after an effigy of Joe Biden accompanied by the word "cheater" was hung from its second-story roof with a rope,

value.title: How Joe Biden's leads in Georgia, Pennsylvania, Nevada, give him a clear path to 270 electoral votes
value.excerpt: Joe Biden's lead is growing in key states. Former Vice President Joe Biden is on the verge of reaching 270 electoral votes and winning the race for president after he surged ahead in Georgia early Friday morning and hours later in Pennsylvania.

value.title: Secret Service to dispatch extra protection squad to Joe Biden's campaign headquarters in Delaware
value.excerpt: The extra security will be assigned to the Wilmington Convention Center, Delaware, where the Biden campaign is headquartered.

value.title: Biden's 1 electoral vote from Nebraska district could prove pivotal to his White House bid
value.excerpt: Omaha, Neb., became “Jomaha” as Democratic nominee Joe Biden won a single electoral vote from the state’s 2nd Congressional District.

value.title: EXPLAINER: Why AP called Michigan for Biden
value.excerpt: WHY AP CALLED MICHIGAN FOR BIDEN:

value.title: The view in Wisconsin: Biden holds a slim lead after nearly all votes are counted.
value.excerpt: Wisconsin’s municipal clerks are nearly finished counting the state’s ballots, and former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has a lead of slightly more than 20,000 votes over President Trump, said Ann Jacobs,

value.title: Totals from Milwaukee, Kenosha and Green Bay push Biden to a 20,000 vote lead in Wisconsin
value.excerpt: Trump did worse in much of Milwaukee and Madison than he did four years ago, but did a little better in much of northern and central Wisconsin.

value.title: Kid Rock responds to Lady Gaga's Biden endorsement, shows 'what camo is really worn for'
value.excerpt: Kid Rock seemed to have a go at Lady Gaga on Tuesday, days after the pop star went viral with her own pro-Joe Biden video.

value.title: In the Minneapolis neighborhood where George Floyd died, voters disagree with Biden on policing. But they're voting for him anyway.
value.excerpt: Voters in Powderhorn Park told Insider they think President Donald Trump is even worse, so they voted for Joe Biden despite their reservations.

value.title: Biden signs wall of childhood home: 'From this house to the White House'
value.excerpt: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden waves to onlookers from the steps of his childhood home on Nov. 3 in Scranton, Pa. | Drew Angerer/ Former Vice President Joe Biden signed one of the living room walls of his childhood home during a stop in Scranton,

value.title: What to watch in battleground Florida — A 'really tough state' to call — Biden lashes out at DeSantis
value.excerpt: BY THE NUMBERS — So far, 4,649,919 vote-by-mail ballots have been cast for the November election, according to the latest information on the state Division of Elections website. Of those, 2,112,081 have come from Democrats and 1,

value.title: Biden Gets an Endorsement From Silicon Valley: Live Business Updates
value.excerpt: A group of 11 founders, investors and business leaders from the technology industry endorsed Democratic presidential nominee Joseph R. Biden Jr. in a letter published on Monday, s

value.title: Facebook admits it 'improperly' blocked some political ads due to 'technical issues' as Joe Biden's campaign slams it for being 'wholly unprepared'
value.excerpt: Facebook said no ads were blocked "because of any partisan consideration," as Biden's camp accused the company of offering "no clarity" on the issue.

value.title: Glenn Greenwald leaves The Intercept, claiming he was ‘censored’ over an article he wrote on Joe Biden
value.excerpt: Journalist Glenn Greenwald said Thursday that he was leaving The Intercept, the news website he helped found, claiming that it had refused to publish an article he wrote on Joe Biden unless he removed sections that were critical of the Democratic presidential nominee.

value.title: Chuck Todd Slammed For Saying Joe Biden Takes COVID-19 'Too Seriously'
value.excerpt: The MSNBC host said that Biden was accepting a smaller footprint by not engaging in high-risk campaign acitivities

value.title: Biden, Cunningham hold narrow leads in North Carolina: poll
value.excerpt: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden has a narrow lead over President Trump in North Carolina, while Democrat Cal Cunningham holds a similarly slim lead in the Tarheel State’s marquee Senate race in a new survey released Thursday.

value.title: Biden and Cunningham Hold Slim Leads in North Carolina, Poll Finds
value.excerpt: Joe Biden and Cal Cunningham both led their Republican rivals by three points, a Times/Siena College survey found. Perhaps most notably, 64 percent of respondents said they had already voted.

value.title: WATCH: Joe Biden holds drive-in rally in Tampa, Florida
value.excerpt: Both nominees are now focusing on encouraging voters to turn out in person on Election Day, next Tuesday. More than 73 million Americans have already voted, either by absentee or by mail.

value.title: Biden vows to pass LGBTQ rights legislation in first 100 days
value.excerpt: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden has promised to make the Equality Act a "top legislative priority" should he win Tuesday’s election.

value.title: Joe Biden: We can restore the soul of our nation | Raleigh News & Observer
value.excerpt: The Editorial Board invited both presidential candidates to make their case to voters.
